Job Title: Engineer building & construction / stability engineer / bouwkundig ingenieur stabiliteit / stabiliteitsingenieur
Bio:
Analysing and evaluating building designs in terms of stability
and contributing ideas.

For both first and second opinions: we simply enjoy squeezing the most out of projects. 
Objective: preparation of studies with an emphasis on optimisation, savings and increased returns.
A creative structural engineering firm thinks along with the architect, 
but at the same time thinks primarily like a project developer/client (budget) as well as an executing contractor (practice).
However, always with the utmost respect for architecture and design: maximum integration of the supporting structure into the design.
Focus on drawing up a stability dossier that is as economical and optimal as possible, both financially and technically, in order to achieve maximum return on your project in terms of structural costs. 
In this context, the fee should not be considered a cost, but an investment: creation of a multiple return effect in the return on the project.
the more precise and logical the entire structure is engineered in terms of stability in one go, the less material is used and therefore the lower the construction costs, and the faster the execution times
this is even more important now due to the high prices of raw materials and other materials
Moreover, the lower the CO2 consumption, 
the smaller the ecological footprint of the design in terms of structural work/stability.
A win-win for all parties.
